unit.comment: /* ** $Id: loslib.c $ ** Standard Operating System library ** See Copyright Notice in lua.h */
/* options for ISO C 99 and POSIX */
/* ** By default, Lua uses gmtime/localtime, except when POSIX is available, ** where it uses gmtime_r/localtime_r */
unit.cpp:define: #define lua_tmpnam(b,e) { \ strcpy(b, LUA_TMPNAMTEMPLATE); \ e = mkstemp(b); \ if (e != -1) close(e); \ e = (e == -1); }

function.name: os_execute
os_remove
os_rename
os_tmpname
os_getenv

unit.comment: /* ** About the overflow check: an overflow cannot occur when time ** is represented by a lua_Integer, because either lua_Integer is ** large enough to represent all int fields or it is not large enough ** to represent a time that cause a field to overflow. However, if ** times are represented as doubles and lua_Integer is int, then the ** time 0x1.e1853b0d184f6p+55 would cause an overflow when adding 1900 ** to compute the year. */

function.name: setfield
function.parameter_list: (lua_State *L, const char *key, int value, int delta)

function.name: setboolfield
setallfields
getboolfield
getfield
function.parameter_list: (lua_State *L, const char *key, int d, int delta)

function.name: checkoption
l_checktime

unit.comment: /* maximum size for an individual 'strftime' item */

function.name: os_date
os_time
os_difftime
os_setlocale
os_exit

unit.decl_stmt: static const luaL_Reg syslib[] = { {"clock", os_clock}, {"date", os_date}, {"difftime", os_difftime}, {"execute", os_execute}, {"exit", os_exit}, {"getenv", os_getenv}, {"remove", os_remove}, {"rename", os_rename}, {"setlocale", os_setlocale}, {"time", os_time}, {"tmpname", os_tmpname}, {NULL, NULL} };
